back.definition: to cause someone to have a particular feeling
examples: The movie's suspenseful scenes really *arouse* my curiosity.
The passionate speech *aroused* strong emotions in the audience.

back.definition: the causing of strong feelings or excitement in someone
examples: His speech caused an *arousal* of patriotic fervor among the crowd.
The music created a sense of *arousal* in the listeners.

back.definition: quite, but not extremely
examples: The hike was *pretty* challenging, but we made it to the top.
She's *pretty* confident that she'll pass the exam.

back.definition: attractive in a delicate way without being truly beautiful
examples: The garden was filled with *pretty* flowers.
She wore a *pretty* dress to the party.

back.definition: to make something look more attractive
examples: She decided to *prettify* the room with some colorful decorations.
Adding a few accessories can *prettify* even the simplest outfit.

back.definition: impressive and large or important
examples: The palace was a *grand* structure with towering spires.
She made a *grand* entrance at the party.

back.definition: the amount of space that is contained within an object or solid shape
examples: The *volume* of the box is calculated by multiplying its length, width, and height.
You can adjust the *volume* of the music using the control knob.

back.definition: the level of sound produced by a television, radio, etc.
examples: Please turn up the *volume* so we can hear the movie better.
The *volume* of the music was so loud that it could be heard from the next room.

back.definition: a book, especially one that is part of a series
examples: She has a large collection of *volumes* from the fantasy series.
The library contains several *volumes* of historical documents.

back.definition: to make a picture of something or someone with a pencil or pen
examples: He likes to *draw* landscapes in his sketchbook.
She *drew* a portrait of her friend for their birthday.

back.definition: to pull or direct something in a particular direction
examples: He *drew* the curtains closed to block out the sunlight.
The magnet *draws* metal objects toward it.

back.definition: a large bus with comfortable seats used for long journeys
examples: We traveled to the city by *coach*.
The *coach* ride was smooth and comfortable.

back.definition: someone whose job is to teach people to improve at a sport, skill, or school subject
examples: The basketball *coach* trained the team every day.
She hired a private *coach* to help her preparefor the exam.

back.definition: to give someone something that they need
examples: The company *provided* all employees with laptops.
Parents must *provide* food and shelter for their children.

back.definition: a company or person that gives you something you need
examples: The internet *provider* offers high-speed connections to its customers.
She works as a healthcare *provider* in a local clinic.

back.definition: the act of providing something
examples: The *provision* of food and water is essential during a disaster.
The government made *provisions* for housing displaced families.

back.definition: to deal successfully with a difficult situation
examples: She struggled to *cope with* the loss of her loved one.
She's finding it hard to *cope with* the pressure of her new job.

back.definition: the particular state that something or someone is in
examples: The car was in excellent *condition* after being serviced.
He's in no *condition* to drive after drinking.

back.definition: to (cause to) arrive on the ground or other surface after moving down through the air
examples: The plane will *land* at the airport in an hour.
The bird gracefully *lands* on the branch.

back.definition: the surface of the earth that is not covered by water
examples: They bought a house with a large plot of *land*.
The farmer works the *land* to grow crops.

back.definition: the area that is included in or dealt with by something; space or opportunity for action, thought, etc.
examples: The project was beyond the *scope* of our resources.
She widened the *scope* of her investigation.

back.definition: a group of similar things or people, especially one that you can hold in your hand or carry.
examples: He bought a *pack* of gum at the store.
A *pack* of wolves roamed the forest.

back.definition: an object or group of objects wrapped in paper or plastic, or packed in a box.
examples: The *package* was delivered to my door.
She received a *package* in the mail.

back.definition: an activity involving skill in making things by hand.
examples: She enjoys practicing her *craft* on weekends.
The artisan displayed his *craft* at the fair.

back.definition: a person who is skilled in a particular craft.
examples: The *craftsman* carved a beautiful sculpture.
He is a skilled *craftsman* in woodworking.

back.definition: clever at achieving one's aims by indirect or deceitful methods.
examples: The *crafty* fox evaded capture.
She devised a *crafty* plan to get what she wanted.

back.definition: the value of something measured by its qualities or by the esteem in which it is held.
examples: The book's *worth* was evident by its high price.
He proved his *worth* to the team.

back.definition: having qualities that deserve your respect, attention, or admiration.
examples: She is a *worthy* recipient of the award.
His actions were deemed *worthy* of praise.

back.definition: relating to a city or town.
examples: The *urban* landscape was filled with skyscrapers.
He enjoys the *urban* lifestyle.

back.definition: a small body of still water formed naturally or by artificial means.
examples: They went fishing in the *pond*.
A family of ducks lived in the *pond*.

back.definition: easy to recognize because of being seen, met, heard, etc before
examples: She felt *familiar* with the surroundings.
The sound of the old clock was *familiar* to him.

back.definition: close acquaintance with or knowledge of something
examples: His *familiarity* with the subject made the lecture interesting.
She has a deep *familiarity* with local customs.

back.definition: not known or recognized
examples: The terrain was completely *unfamiliar* to them.
He felt *unfamiliar* with the new software.

back.definition: to give (someone) knowledge or understanding of something
examples: The teacher tried to *familiarize* the students with the new concept.
He took a moment to *familiarize* himself with the controls.

back.definition: to hit something gently, and often repeatedly, especially making short sharp noises
examples: He *tapped* the table with his pen.
She gently *tapped* on the door.

back.definition: a device by which a flow of liquid or gas from a pipe or container can be controlled
examples: Turn off the *tap* when not in use.
The kitchen *tap* was leaking.

back.definition: an upright pillar, typically cylindrical, supporting an arch or other structure or standing alone as a monument
examples: The ancient *columns* were still standing.
He admired the Greek *columns* in the old temple.

back.definition: the fact of having committed a specified or implied offense or crime
examples: He felt a deep sense of *guilt* after the accident.
The evidence clearly showed her *guilt*.

back.definition: having committed an offense, crime, or wrong, especially against moral or penal law
examples: The jury found him *guilty* of all charges.
She felt *guilty* about lying to her friend.

back.definition: either of the two long parts of the upper body that are attached to the shoulders and have the hands at the end.
examples: He broke his *arm* while playing football.
She raised her *arm* to ask a question.

back.definition: the part of the arm between the elbow and the wrist.
examples: He has a tattoo on his *forearm*.
She felt pain in her *forearm* after lifting the weights.

back.definition: a room used for a special or official purpose, or a group of people who form (part of) a parliament.
examples: The meeting was held in the council *chamber*.
The heart has four *chambers*.

back.definition: to need to pay or give something to someone because they have lent money to you, or in exchange for something they have done for you.
examples: I *owe* you ten dollars.
She still *owes* money on her car loan.

back.definition: to contain something as a part of something else, or to make something part of something else.
examples: The tour *includes* a visit to the museum.
Please *include* your contact information in the email.

back.definition: the fact of including someone or something, especially as part of a group, list, etc.
examples: The *inclusion* of more women in the workforce is vital.
His *inclusion* in the team was a great decision.

back.definition: containing all; not keeping any out.
examples: We aim to create an *inclusive* environment.
The price is *inclusive* of taxes.

back.definition: in a way that includes everyone and everything.
examples: The policy applies *inclusively* to all employees.
We need to think *inclusively* to solve this problem.

back.definition: to choose someone officially for a job or responsibility.
examples: They decided to *appoint* a new manager.
She was *appointed* to the board of directors.

back.definition: a formal arrangement to meet or visit someone at a particular time and place.
examples: I have a dentist *appointment* tomorrow.
She scheduled an *appointment* with the doctor.

back.definition: the act of officially choosing someone for a job, or the job itself.
examples: His *appointment* as CEO was unexpected.
The *appointment* of the new judge was confirmed.

back.definition: to take part in special enjoyable activities in order to show that a particular occasion is important
examples: We always *celebrate* birthdays with a cake.
They *celebrated* their anniversary by going out for dinner.

back.definition: a special social event, such as a party, when you celebrate something
examples: The town held a big *celebration* for the holiday.
We had a *celebration* after the graduation ceremony.

back.definition: celebrating an important event or a special occasion
examples: There was a *celebratory* dinner for the award winners.
She gave a *celebratory* speech at the event.

back.definition: to use something for the wrong purpose in a way that is harmful or morally wrong
examples: He was accused of *abusing* his power.
The law protects against *abuse* of animals.

back.definition: using rude and offensive words
examples: He was fired for making *abusive* comments.
The manager's *abusive* language shocked everyone.

back.definition: to break up and move soil using a tool, a machine, or your hands
examples: He loves to *dig* in the garden.
We need to *dig* a hole for the new tree.

back.definition: the way that someone behaves
examples: His *behavior* in class is always exemplary.
We need to address her disruptive *behavior*.

back.definition: a set of wires, covered by plastic, that carries electricity, phone signals, etc.
examples: The internet *cable* needs to be replaced.
She tripped over the *cable* in the hallway.

back.definition: able to learn, understand, and think about things quickly and easily
examples: She is an *intelligent* student who excels in all subjects.
The *intelligent* design of the system makes it easy to use.

back.definition: the ability to learn, understand, and think about things
examples: His *intelligence* is evident in the way he solves complex problems.
Artificial *intelligence* is revolutionizing many industries.

back.definition: to agree that something is true, especially unwillingly
examples: He had to *admit* his mistake.
She reluctantly *admitted* to breaking the vase.

back.definition: the act of agreeing that something is true, especially unwillingly
examples: Her *admission* of guilt surprised everyone.
The *admission* fee to the museum is $10.

back.definition: used when you are agreeing that something is true, especially unwillingly
examples: *Admittedly*, it was a difficult challenge.
*Admittedly*, I was wrong about the issue.

back.definition: the thick, yellowish-white liquid that forms on the top of milk
examples: Would you like some *cream* in your coffee?
She whipped the *cream* until it was thick.

back.definition: thick and smooth like cream; containing cream
examples: The soup has a *creamy* texture.
She prefers *creamy* sauces for her pasta.

back.definition: to take something for your own use, usually without permission
examples: He tried to *appropriate* the funds for personal use.
The company *appropriated* the new technology without permission.

back.definition: suitable or right for a particular situation or occasion
examples: Her outfit was *appropriate* for the occasion.
It is important to wear *appropriate* attire to a job interview.

back.definition: the act of taking something for your own use, usually without permission
examples: The *appropriation* of public funds is illegal.
He was accused of cultural *appropriation*.

back.definition: the part of a plant that grows down into the earth to get water and food and holds the plant firm in the ground
examples: The tree's *roots* are deep and strong.
She pulled the weed out by the *root*.

back.definition: to examine or look for the differences between persons or things
examples: It is difficult to *compare* apples with oranges.
She always *compares* prices before buying anything.

back.definition: similar in size, amount, or quality to something else
examples: The new model is *comparable* to the old one.
Their results are not directly *comparable* with each other.

back.definition: so good or great that nothing or no one else could achieve the same standard
examples: Her beauty is *incomparable* to anyone else's.
The view from the mountain top is simply *incomparable*.

back.definition: involving the comparison of two or more things
examples: We conducted a *comparative* study between the two groups.
She made a *comparative* analysis of the data.

back.definition: as compared to something else
examples: The exam was *comparatively* easy compared to last year's.
Living costs are *comparatively* high in this area.

back.definition: being, relating to, or belonging to a person or to people as opposed to animals
examples: Every *human* has the right to freedom.
The *human* body is capable of amazing things.

back.definition: extremely cruel; not having the qualities of kindness, pity, or sympathy that people usually have
examples: His treatment of the prisoners was *inhuman*.
The dictator's actions were *inhuman* by any standard.

back.definition: people in general; all people
examples: We must strive for the betterment of *humanity*.
Acts of kindness restore faith in *humanity*.

back.definition: to kill in a violent way
examples: The dragon was *slain* by the knight.
He *slew* his enemies with great ferocity.

back.definition: to continue to exist past the usual time, or to continue to do something in a determined way even when facing difficulties or opposition
examples: She *persisted* in her efforts despite the challenges.
If symptoms *persist*, consult your doctor.

back.definition: lasting for a long time or difficult to get rid of
examples: He has been *persistent* in asking for a promotion.
The rain has been *persistent* throughout the week.

back.definition: the fact that someone or something persists
examples: Her *persistence* in achieving her goals is admirable.
The *persistence* of the cold weather is unusual for this time of year.

back.definition: having a larger distance from one side to the other than is usual or expected
examples: The river is very *wide* at this point.
She has a *wide* range of interests.

back.definition: to become, or to make something become, wider
examples: They plan to *widen* the road to accommodate more traffic.
Her eyes *widened* with surprise.
